info.document:
Sept 16 (Reuters) -    For other diaries, please see:
U.S. Federal Reserve
Polling unit diary
Today in Washington
Political and general news
-----------------------------------------------------------
This Diary is filed daily. ** Indicates new events
-----------------------------------------------------------
SATURDAY SEPTEMBER 16
TALLINN, Estonia - European Union finance ministers and central bank governors meet for informal
talks, mainly on further Eurozone integration, capital markets union and taxes (Final Day).
MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 18
** BASEL - ECB Board member Sabine Lautenschlager participating in Panel II "Policy challenges
in the banking sector" at conference "Supervisory policy implementation in the current
macro-financial environment: a cross-sectoral journey," organised by BIS in Basel, Switzerland -
1430 GMT.
ROME - ECB Supervisor Ignazio Angeloni participates in a panel discussion at Italian Banking
Conference 2017 in Rome, Italy - 0845 GMT.
WASHINGTON - Bank of England Governor Mark Carney gives a lecture at the International Monetary
Fund (IMF), then has a public discussion with IMF Managing Director Christine Lagarde - 1500
GMT.
SASKATCHEWAN, Canada - Bank of Canada Deputy Governor Timothy Lane speaks at the Saskatoon
Regional Economic Development Authority – 1800 GMT.
TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 19
WASHINGTON - U.S. Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) starts its two-day
meeting on interest rates.

WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 20
STOCKHOLM - Swedish Deputy Central Bank Governor Martin Floden talks about monetary policy -
1200 GMT
WASHINGTON - U.S. Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) announces its decision
on interest rates followed by a statement - 1800 GMT.
WASHINGTON – U.S. Federal Reserve chair Janet Yellen holds a news conference – 1830 GMT.
FRANKFURT - ECB Governing Council meeting. No interest rate announcements scheduled.
TOKYO - Bank of Japan monetary policy meeting (to September 21).
THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 21
** FRANKFURT - ECB Board member Peter Praet chairing the policy panel at the ECB conference "Low
inflation: Lessons from the past! Lessons for the future?" in Frankfurt, Germany - 0930 GMT.
** ZURICH - Speech by Stanford University Professor of Economics John B. Taylor on "Ideas and
Institutions for Monetary Policy Making," Karl Brunner Distinguished Lecture, ETH, Zurich.
** FRANKFURT - ECB President Mario Draghi gives welcome remarks at the 2nd ESRB annual
conference in Frankfurt - 1315 GMT.
STOCKHOLM - Swedish Central Bank minutes from monetary policy will be published - 0730 GMT.
FRANKFURT - European Central Bank general council meeting.
OSLO - Norway Central Bank holds a press conference after the announcing its interest rate
decision and issuing its monetary policy report – 0830 GMT.

FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 22
** FRANKFURT - ECB Board member Pentti Hakkarainen  participating in Session 1: "The challenges
and future of banking in the EU" at 2nd ESRB annual conference in Frankfurt  - 0645 GMT.
** SARAJEVO - ECB Board member Benoît Ceure gives Keynote statement at conference "20 years of
stability" on the occasion of the 20th Anniversary of the Central Bank of Bosnia and Herzegovina
in Sarajevo - 0715 GMT.
** DUBLIN - ECB President Mario Draghi gives Keynote speech at Henry Grattan Lecture Invitation
organised by Trinity College (School of Social Sciences and Philosophy) in Dublin - 0800 GMT.
** COURMAYEUR, Italy - ECB Supervisor Ignazio Angeloni gives Speech at Convegno Courmayeur "La
banca nel nuovo ordinamento europeo: luci e ombre" organised by Fondazione Centro nazionale di
prevenzione e difesa sociale-CNPDS in Milan and Fondazione Courmayeur Mont Blanc in Courmayeur,
Italy - 0845 GMT.
** DUBLIN - ECB President Mario Draghi Participates in Student Roundtable/Dialogue at Trinity
College in Dublin - 0930 GMT
** FRANKFURT - ECB Vice President Vitor Constancio gives closing remarks at the ECB conference
"Low inflation: Lessons from the past! Lessons for the future?" in Frankfurt, Germany - 1115
GMT.
** FRANKFURT - ECB Vice President Vitor Constancio chairing panel "Macroprudential policy beyond
banking" at the 2nd ESRB annual conference in Frankfurt, Germany - 1315 GMT.
LINKOPING, Sweden - Riksbank Deputy Governor Martin Floden will give a guest lecture to students
on current monetary policy and the central bank's role in society - 1015 GMT.
ZURICH - Federal Reserve Bank of San Francisco President John Williams hold a media availability
during the closed Swiss National Bank Research Conference 2017 - 1000 GMT.
OKLAHOMA City, Oklahoma - Federal Reserve Bank of Dallas President Robert Kaplan participates in
moderated Q&A session before the Federal Reserve Banks of Kansas City and Dallas Energy
Conference: "Global Oil Supply & Demand: Prospects for Greater Balance" - 1730 GMT.
ZURICH - Dewet Moser, alternate member of the governing board of the  Swiss National Bank gives
speech on  "The international reform process so far and the importance of interest rate
benchmarks from a central bank perspective", Joint Event SIX Swiss Exchange and SFAA Swiss Bond
Commission – 0900 GMT.
OKLAHOMA City, Oklahoma - Federal Reserve Bank of Kansas City President Esther George gives
opening keynote before the Federal Reserve Banks of Kansas City and Dallas Energy Conference:
"Global Oil Supply & Demand: Prospects for Greater Balance," – 1330 GMT.
FRANKFURT - Top ECB officials speak at a financial stability conference, where speakers include
ECB Vice President Vitor Constancio, European Banking Authority (EBA) chief Andrea Enria, and
Riksbank chief Stefan Ingves.
TRONDHEIM, Norway – Norges Bank Governor Oystein Olsen gives a speech to students at The
Norwegian University of Science and Technology (NTNU) - 0900 GMT.
LONDON - An OMFIF City Lecture with Claudio Borio, head of the monetary and economic department
at the Bank for International Settlements - 0930 GMT.

MONDAY, SEPTEMBER 25
SYRACUSE, N.Y. - Federal Reserve Bank of New York President William Dudley speaks on "Workforce
Development" at Onondaga Community College - 1230 GMT.
GRAND FORKS, North Dakota - Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari speaks
at Eye of the Hawk Town Hall Event – 2230 GMT.
GRAND RAPIDS, Michigan - Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Charles Evans speaks before
the Economic Club of Grand Rapids - 1640 GMT.
OSAKA, Japan – Bank of Japan Governor Haruhiko Kuroda will deliver speech and take questions
from business leaders in Osaka - 0535 GMT.
OSLO – Norges Bank Governor Oystein Olsen speaks at a seminar to celebrate the 50th anniversary
of the Norwegian Technical Calculation Committee for Wage Settlements (TBU), organized by the
Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs in Oslo – 0935 GMT.
LONDON - Bank of England's Financial Policy Committee statement to be published – 0830 GMT.
TOKYO - Bank of Japan releases the minutes of its monetary policy meeting held on July 19 and 20
- 2350 GMT.
TUESDAY, SEPTEMBER 26
ATLANTA - Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic speaks on the economic
outlook and monetary policy before the Atlanta Press Club – 1630 GMT.
CLEVELAND, Ohio - Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Loretta Mester moderates a "global
outlook" panel at the 59th National Association for Business Economics annual meeting, which
will debate collective challenges under the theme "Prospects for Growth: Reassessing the
Fundamentals" – 1330 GMT.
CLEVELAND, Ohio - Federal Reserve Chair Janet Yellen speaks at a luncheon before the National
Association for Business Economics 59th Annual Meeting, themed "Prospects for Growth:
Reassessing the Fundamentals" – 1550 GMT.
BRATISLAVA, Slovakia - ECB Governing Council member and Slovak central bank (NBS) Governor Jozef
Makuch holds a news conference – 1100 GMT.
WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 27
KIRKSVILLE, Missouri - Federal Reserve Bank of St. Louis President James Bullard gives
presentation on the U.S. economy and monetary policy before an event hosted by Truman State
University - 1730 GMT.
MINNEAPOLIS - Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis President Neel Kashkari makes welcoming
remarks at Tribal Community Perspectives on Higher Education – 1315 GMT.
KRISTIANSAND, Norway - Norges Bank Governor Oystein Olsen speaks at Norges Bank's Regional
Network in Kristiansnad – 0915 GMT.
BODO, Norway - Norges Bank Deputy Governor Jon Nicolaisen speaks at an industry conference in
Bodo – 0900 GMT.
NEWFOUNDLAND AND LABRADOR, Canada - Bank of Canada Governor Stephen S. Poloz speaks at St.
John's Board of Trade, followed by press conference – 1600 GMT.
NEW YORK - Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Eric S. Rosengren speaks before the Money
Marketeers of New York University - 2130 GMT.
WELLINGTON - Reserve Bank of New Zealand announces official cash rate - 2000 GMT.
THURSDAY, SEPTEMBER 28
TOKYO - BOJ Governor Haruhiko Kuroda delivers a brief speech at the annual meeting of Japanese
securities firms - 0635 GMT.
COPENHAGEN - Norges Bank Deputy Governor Egil Matsen speaks in Copenhagan – 0720 GMT.
LONDON - Reserve Bank of Australia Deputy Governor Guy Debelle will give speech at the Bank of
England conference.
TOKYO - Bank of Japan to release summary of opinions from board members at September 20-21
policy meeting – 2350 GMT.
STOCKHOLM - Riksbank executive board meeting - 1100 GMT.
FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 29
HAMAR, Norway - Jon Nicolaisen and Egil Matsen, deputy governors at Norges Bank, speak at Norges
Bank's Regional Network – 0825 GMT.
STOCKHOLM - Riksbank general council meeting - 0800 GMT.
MONDAY, OCTOBER 2
OSLO - Norway Central Bank holds conference: Big Data, Machine Learning and the Macroeconomy (to
October 3).
WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 4
FRANKFURT - ECB Governing Council meeting. No interest rate announcements scheduled.
THURSDAY, OCTOBER 5
BRIDGETOWN, Barbados - DeLisle Worrell, governor of the Central Bank of Barbados, and OMFIF hold
the second Main Meeting in Latin America and Caribbean (to October 6).
FRIDAY, OCTOBER 6
AUSTIN, Texas - Federal Reserve Bank of Atlanta President Raphael Bostic speaks before the
Investing in America's Workforce conference - 1315 GMT.
MONDAY, OCTOBER 9
LUXEMBOURG – Eurogroup meeting.
TUESDAY, OCTOBER 10
LUXEMBOURG - Economic and Financial Affairs Council meeting
WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 11
** LEKNES - Norges Bank Deputy Governor Jon Nicolaisen gives a speech at a Coastal Business
Conference.
WASHINGTON - Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) will release the minutes
from its September policy meeting - 1800 GMT.
THURSDAY, OCTOBER 12
WASHINGTON - An OMFIF-RAMP breakfast on the occasion of the IMF-WBG Annual Meetings.
FRIDAY, OCTOBER 13
** WASHINGTON - Norges Bank Governor Oystein Olsen gives a speech at a investor seminar hosted
by J.P. Morgan - 0230 GMT.
BOSTON - Federal Reserve Board Governor Jerome Powell speaks at a conference, "Are Rules Made to
be Broken? Discretion and Monetary Policy", hosted by the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston.
BOSTON - Federal Reserve Bank of Boston President Eric Rosengren gives welcome and opening
remarks and Federal Reserve Board Governor Jerome Powell speaks at a conference on "Are Rules
Made to be Broken? Discretion and Monetary Policy," hosted by the Federal Reserve Bank of Boston
- 1230 GMT.
TUESDAY, OCTOBER 17
STOCKHOLM - Riksbank executive board meeting – 1100 GMT.
WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 18
WASHINGTON - U.S. Federal Reserve issues its Beige Book on economic condition - 1800 GMT.
NEW YORK - Federal Reserve Vice Chair Stanley Fischer speaks before the Money Marketeers of New
York University.
THURSDAY, OCTOBER 19
STOCKHOLM - Riksbank executive board meeting – 0700 GMT.

WEDNESDAY, OCTOBER 25
OTTAWA - Bank of Canada key policy Interest rate announcement and Monetary Policy Report
followed by a press conference – 1400 GMT.
STOCKHOLM - Swedish central bank holds monetary policy meeting no. 5 - 0700 GMT.
THURSDAY, OCTOBER 26
OSLO -  Norway Central Bank announces interest rate decision – 0800 GMT.
STOCKHOLM - Swedish Central Bank announces interest rate decision. Monetary Policy Report will
be published - 0730 GMT.
FRANKFURT - ECB Governing Council meeting, followed by interest rate announcement
FRANKFURT - ECB President Mario Draghi holds a press conference, after the interest rate meeting
MONDAY, OCTOBER 30
TOKYO - Bank of Japan holds monetary policy meeting (to October 31).
TUESDAY, OCTOBER 31
WASHINGTON - U.S. Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) starts its two-day
meeting on interest rates.

WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 1
WASHINGTON - U.S. Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) announces its decision
on interest rate - 1800 GMT.
THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 2
OSLO - Norway Central Bank reports financial stability 2017 - 0900 GMT.
LONDON - Bank of England announces rate decision, releases its latest inflation report and
publishes the minutes of the meeting - 1100 GMT.
MONDAY, NOVEMBER 6
TOKYO – Bank of Japan issues minutes of monetary policy meetings.
NEW YORK - Federal Reserve Bank of New York President William Dudley speaks before a luncheon of
the Economic Club of New York.
WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 8
STOCKHOLM - Riksbank executive board meeting – 0800 GMT.
THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 9
STOCKHOLM - Swedish Central Bank minutes from monetary policy will be published - 0830 GMT.
WELLINGTON - Reserve Bank of New Zealand announces official cash rate and Monetary Policy
Statement media conference.
FRIDAY, NOVEMBER 10
STOCKHOLM - Riksbank general council meeting - 1200 GMT.
WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 15
NEW YORK - Bank of Canada Senior Deputy Governor Wilkins speaks before Money Marketeers group in
New York City.
THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 16
GENEVA - Andrea Maechler, member of the governing board of the Swiss National Bank; and Dewet
Moser, alternate member of the governing board of the Swiss National Bank, speak at the money
market event – 1700 GMT.
WASHINGTON - Federal Reserve Bank of Cleveland President Loretta Mester speaks before the Cato
Institute 35th Annual Monetary Conference – 1410 GMT.
MONDAY, NOVEMBER 20
STOCKHOLM - Riksbank executive board meeting – 0800 GMT.
WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 22
WASHINGTON - U.S. Federal Reserve's Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) will release the
minutes from its October policy meeting – 1900 GMT.
STOCKHOLM - Swedish Central Bank to publish Financial Stability Report 2017 - 0830 GMT.
THURSDAY, NOVEMBER 23
MEXICO CITY - Mexico central bank issues mintues of monetary policy meeting.
TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 28
OTTAWA - Bank of Canada Governor Stephen S. Poloz and Bank of Canada Senior Deputy Governor
Carolyn Wilkins will hold press conference to discuss the contents of the Financial System
Review – 1615 GMT.
FRANKFURT, Germany - The European Central Bank releases monthly data on lending and money
supply.
LONDON – Bank of England to publish Financial Stability Report November 2017.
WEDNESDAY, NOVEMBER 29
WASHINGTON - U.S. Federal Reserve issues its Beige Book on economic condition - 1900 GMT.
WELLINGTON - Reserve Bank of New Zealand publishes Financial Stability Report.
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
NOTE: The inclusion of items in this diary does not necessarily mean that Reuters will file a
story based on the event.
For technical issues, please contact Thomson Reuters Customer Support (TRCS) at https://customers.reuters.com/kccontactus/telephone.aspx
